content:
Are cookies accepted in TB Settings/Privacy & Security? It's necessary for OAuth2 authentication.

https://www.reddit.com/r/Thunderbird/comments/15tgopz/trouble_with_thunderbird_with_gmail_accounts/
creator: sfhowes

content:
The only cookies I'm allowing are from accounts.google.com. Remember, I'm picking up mail from AccountA@gmail.com with no problem, it's only AccountB@gmail.com that's giving me trouble--even though all settings are identical except the password.

ETA OK, I've now allowed all cookies, it let me log on (2-factor auth), things are DLing. After it's all set up I'll disallow cookies except from accounts.google.com, see if I can still pick up mail.
creator: curtin.me

content:
OK! The trick is to turn on "Accept all cookies" only for the *first*, login connection, where you go through 2-factor authorization. Then you toggle it off and keep accounts.google.com as the exception.

Thank you so much!

MEC
creator: curtin.me

content: I think a filter like the one in the attached picture will work. Whitelist is an address book that has the whitelisted contacts. Contacts can be copied between address books by drag and drop, while holding Ctrl. Contacts can be added to Personal Address Book from messages by clicking the icon beside the sender in the message header, and can be added to other address books by clicking the icon twice.
creator: sfhowes

content:
On your new system, find the profile with "default-release" in the name.

Copy the CONTENTS of the backup directory with "default-release" in the name, into the new system's "default-release" directory.

content: I'm not a forensic expert, but I'd start with finding out who has the account installed, on a PC or mobile device, and then looking at the date of creation or last modification of the folder by looking at the profile folder. Help/Troubleshooting, Profile Folder, Open Folder, then open the account subfolder of Mail or ImapMail, and look for the folder name. Beyond that, I think you'd have to consult with the account provider to get more details about who is accessing the account and when.

content:
Remote notebooks are linked via cardbook. If cardbook is deactivated, it is no longer possible to synchronize with NextCloud.

Carbook does save my changes locally, but it refuses to synchronize these changes for contacts with an encoded birthday.

- If I make a change to a card on cardbook, it only synchronizes if the birthday is empty. - If I make the same change on Nextcloud, the synchronization is accepted whether or not there is an encoded birthday, and I see this change on my cardbook.

content: Highlight the account name in folder pane, right click, select 'subscribe' and UNtick the box for AllMail. That is the recommendation from Thunderbird. The Allmail folder doubles all retrieval and outgoing resource use and significantly increases disk space. After doing that, you should exit thunderbird and then delete the allmail folder in the profile to regain the space.

content: IF you and he used the same email provider (where the info to right of the @ is the same), then YES. Carefully review the incoming server panes for the two and the SMTP server panes so that you use exactly the same content. If you later have problems, then posting screenshots of the two computers' server settings may prove helpful, but I feel you may have found the solution. Remember; there are TWO places for possible server names, one for incoming and one for outgoing (SMTP). The other computer may have used that name on both, or just one.
creator: davidsk

content:
The certificate error is probably due to your antivirus app intercepting secure connections. Disable email scanning or add the TB profile folder as an exclusion or exception in antivirus settings.

content:
Try removing the entries for the accounts, imap://, smtp:// and oauth://, from Saved Passwords in TB, check that cookies are accepted in TB Settings/Privacy & Security, disable a VPN if one is used, restart TB, enter the account password in the OAuth window to allow access.

The EmClient settings are not more helpful than the ones provided by TB.

content:
The Oauth browser-like window appears on first connection and is where you enter the account password. When the authentication completes, an oauth:// entry is added to Saved Passwords.

There are millions of gmail accounts working in TB, so there must be some external app that's interfering. Some antivirus apps like Norton have password managers.

content:
""...Nainštaloval som Thunderbird a jeho profil. Všetko funguje dobre.... "" Nefunguje dobre. Podľa mňa ste nedodržali postup. Asi ste nakopírovali komplet profil starého Thunderbirdu.

Správny postup: Do NOVÉHO PROFILU ste si mali cez "Nástroje“ - „Importovať" - „Importovať z inej inštalácie Thunderbirdu“ importovať všetky účty a nastavenia, adresáre, e-mailové správy a kalendár ... zo STARÉHO (pôvodného) profilu Thunderbirdu - zvoľte si iba to čo potrebujete. https://imgbank.cz/images/2023/10/25/Thunderbird_import.jpg
creator: Ansamb

content: Ja si zo zo starého PROFILU Thunderbirdu prekopírujem do nového PROFILU Thunderbirdu celý priečinok Mail (Ak mate prístup POP3) a priečinok ImapMail (ak mate prístup IMAP). Tam je všetko to čo potrebujete - všetka pošta a nastavenie účtov. Takto mate teraz skopírovanú poštu a nastavenia účtov. Pokiaľ spustite Thunderbird, tak uvidíte späť svoju starú poštu. C:\Users\<Windows user name>\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\<Profile name>\ http://kb.mozillazine.org/Profile_folder_-_Thunderbird#Windows_Vista.2C_7.2C_8.1_and_10
creator: Ansamb

content: Správný postup je zde: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer pokud ne, je potřeba aby jej někdo z Thunderbird support opravil. Takže ještě jednou - Thunderbird funguje OK dokud nenainstaluji Firefox , nyní funguje o5 OK, neboť jsem Firefox odinstaloval. Nicméně ještě jeden neuvedený detail, Thunderbird funguje OK s Firefoxem, pokud jej běžím v režimu řešení potíží - ovšem je to slepá ulička , vytvoření nového (čistého profilu , bez doplňků a vzhledu a bez HW akcelerace) o5 způsobí nefunkčnost (ta se odstraní deinstalací Firefoxu). Vypadá to jako chyba v dll nebo registru win11 částí Mozilly, neboť odinstalace Firefoxu vždy pomůže . Možná by bylo dobré to nahlásit jako BUG na Mozillu (EN). Ostatně chyba je duplikovatelná a může jí tak nasimulovat každý.
creator: hunkaj

content: Ještě jsem neviděl, že by instalace jednoho programu zrušila připojení jiného. Oba tyhle programy běžně fungují (měly by) současně. Ledaže by v tom Firefoxu byl nějaký tajuplný doplněk, ovlivňující poštu. Tragický vliv mívají i newindowsovské antiviráky (např. Avast, NOD, atp.).
creator: poljos-moz

content: Firefox - čistá instalace Win 11 - čistá instalace Thunderbird - čistá instalace + přenos profilu dle: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer C:\Users\<Windows user name>\AppData\*\Mozilla v době instalace (Firefox Installer.exe) neexistují. Neměly by tedy existovat ani doplňky. Existují pouze doplňky Thunderbird, ale pokud je odeberu, stav se nezmění. Nyní používám chrome - než se bug s Firefoxem odstraní , ale mohu kdykoli nainstalovat jakoukoli verzi Firefoxu a otestovat funkčnost (nefunkčnost) a pak ji zase v případě nefunkčnosti odinstalovat.
creator: hunkaj
